lines.text: Although vice is seldom punished, virtue is always rewarded.
Hypnotic Eyes]
I murdered the real Dr. Nox and assumed his identity. Do not ever try to find me. I am - The Great Vampire.

[note left for Phillipe]
Give up your search, otherwise bad luck awaits you!
[signed]
The Vampires
At midnight, the prisoner will be interrogated by the Grand Inquisitor of the Vampires. At dawn he will be executed in the presence of the Black Committee.
[signed]
The Grand Vampire

[writing]
Can we imagine a more horrifying scene than one of a bandit awakening from a lethargic sleep and lunging at an unfortunate night watchman's throat?

[Phillipe and Mazamette have had a disagreement. Phillipe gets out La Fontaine and points to a passage]
In all things, one must take the end into account.

[intertitle]
The man you killed was a subordinate. I, Satanas, am the Grand Vampire.

[note handed to Moreno]
Since you refuse to surrender, you will see proof of my power at two o'clock. It is useless to try and escape.
[signed]
Satanas
"Parisian women are the most charming I've ever seen."

[note to Irma Vep, who is on a prison-bound ship]
Fake a sprain when you embark. You will be sent to the infirmary in the stern. The explosion will take place at the bow. If you survive, come to Paris. Otherwise, death will be better than perpetual detention.
The Vampire Gang is Not Dead. Satanas poisoned himself in his cell. Who provided the poison?

[final intertitle of Episode 9]
All's well that ends well, but we still haven't seen the last of the Vampires.

[writing]
It is several months since we have heard about the Vampires. But can't we see their crafty hands behind those recent sinister and mysterious headlines?
